record.text: というか、おそらくトークン数の関係で 要件定義.md を読んだり読まなかったりするので、プロンプトで明示的に「要件定義.md を読み込んで」と指示をして読み込みの優先度を上げるのがよいだろう。

Copilot に聞くと、Claude Code では要件仕様（requirement spec）と設計仕様（design spec）を分けて作れるそうなので、あとで試してみよう。無料版の Claude Sonnet でも、要件定義.md と設計.md と分けて作ることができるので、まあ、Kiro じゃないと駄目ってわけではなさそう。

内部モデルに分類があるかわからないが、*.md の中身はそれなりに読み取ってくれる。

Kiro の spec 駆動の例を作っている日本人の例をみると要件 requirements の仕様 specification と設計 design の混乱が見られるが大丈夫だろうか？

Kiro/ClaudeCode 的に PMBOK に則っているかよくわからん

images.alt:
Minimum system requirements for Copilot+ PCs	

Copilot+ PCs are a new class of Windows 11 AI PCs that are powered by a turbocharged neural processing unit (NPU)—a specialized computer chip for AI-intensive processes like real-time translations and image generation— that can perform more than 40 trillion operations per second (TOPS).
To run unique Copilot+ PC experiences, customers will need to acquire new hardware. In addition to the minimum system requirements for Windows 11, Copilot+ PCs must include the following:

Processor: A compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC) with an NPU capable of performing 40+ TOPS. This currently includes:
AMD Ryzen™ AI 300 series
Intel® Core™ Ultra 200V series
Snapdragon® X series
RAM: 16 GB DDR5/LPDDR5
Storage: 256 GB SSD/UFS
Specific features, plus apps and hardware that you add to your Copilot+ PC may have additional hardware, software, or other requirements, and these requirements may change over time.

Standard Windows 11 System Requirements

Processor	1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster with 2 or more cores on a compatible 64-bit processor or System on a Chip (SoC).
RAM	4 gigabytes (GB)
Storage	64 GB or larger storage device. See More information on storage space to keep Windows 11 up-to-date for more details.

record.text: We lurch closer and closer to Snow Crash every day

Yes, like any powerful tool, especially largely general purpose ones, people need to know how to properly use it before using it, and understand what they’re using it with.

Databases, as an example, can have similarly catastrophic outcomes when used by people who don’t know what they’re doing.
The hype isn’t “code assistants work well,” the hype is that LLMs will replace all white collar work or be a drop-in replacement for systems that must be deterministic.

🔮 CONSÉQUENCES CACHÉES

Même sans données classifiées volées :
• Cartographie des systèmes sensibles
• Procédures internes exposées
• Risque de backdoors persistantes

Cette intrusion pourrait être le prélude à des attaques encore plus graves... 😰

🌏 DIMENSION GÉOPOLITIQUE

Des rapports évoquent une attribution à des groupes chinois. Dans un contexte de tensions internationales, cette attaque s'inscrit dans une cyber-guerre froide de plus en plus intense.

Le cyberespace, nouveau champ de bataille ? ⚔️

⚡ COURSE CONTRE LA MONTRE

Microsoft a publié des correctifs le 22 juillet, mais :
• De nouveaux contournements découverts
• La CISA en alerte maximale
• Propagation continue des attaques

C'est le chat et la souris... à l'échelle planétaire ! 🐱🐭

images.alt:
A review for a Little Caesar’s somewhere by Kevin S: 

Stopped into this Little Caesars just trying to get a $6 pizza and ended up in a full on action movie. Just as I grabbed my order, this furious dude barges in yelling about how I cut him off in traffic earlier.
Before I can even respond, he throws a punch but then out of nowhere the guy behind the counter jumps over it like he's been waiting for this moment his whole life and just beats the living hell out of the guy. The guy ran off and the cashier just dusted himself off. I said "are you ok man" and he looked me dead in the eye and said "B*tch, this is Little Caesars. We always hot and ready."
Five stars. Will absolutely return.

record.text: Introducing the Improved Search Job Experience in Azure Monitor Log Analytics

external.description: A search job is an asynchronous query that runs on any data in your Log Analytics workspace, including data from the long-term retention, making the results available for further queries in a new Analytics table within your workspace. To efficiently search massive datasets, Search Job divides queries into smaller time-based segments, processes them in parallel, and returns the results. This approach optimizes scalability and enables reliable analysis, even over petabytes of data. We’re excited to announce significant enhancements to Search Jobs, designed to make large-scale data exploration faster, easier, and more efficient. What’s New in Search Job Our latest update includes several powerful improvements: Intuitive and streamlined UI experience for faster and simpler setup. Cost estimation preview before running a Search Job. Previously, we had system limitations in place to ensure stability. Now, as more customers use Search Job, we’re removing most of these limits to enhance your experience: Result limits are being increased, with support for up to 100 million records coming soon. Enhanced concurrency, allowing more jobs to run in parallel. Removed the search date-range limit, now supporting any date range over the table’s retention. These updates make it easier to explore massive datasets while giving you greater control over costs and performance. Explore the New UI Experience Let’s walk through a familiar scenario to showcase the new UI. Imagine you want to check if a specific client IP address has repeatedly accessed your system over the past year, as part of investigating suspicious activity. With the new Search Job experience, scanning through massive volumes of logs is now fast, simple, and intuitive. Step-by-Step: Start by typing your query or selecting the relevant table - here, we’re querying the SecurityEvent table for a suspicious IP address. Open the ellipsis menu (…) on the right and choose "Search Job". Use the time picker to set your date range. For example, select ‘Last year’ to view a full year of activity, or choose a longer period if needed. Name your new results table, such as SecurityEventJuly25. Before running the job, you’ll see an approximate cost estimation, helping you decide if you want to proceed with the query. Click Run to launch the Search Job. A new table is created in your workspace, allowing you to analyze results efficiently without impacting performance. Run a Search Job UI This new UI flow makes it seamless to handle even large-scale investigations like this, with fewer clicks and better visibility along the way. What’s Next? We’re continuing to enhance Search Job with broader KQL operator support and additional features. Stay tuned for more updates! For a deeper dive into all these improvements, check out the full documentation https://aka.ms/LogAnalyticsSearchJobs. For questions or feedback, feel free to leave a comment on the blog or use the “Give feedback” form directly in the Logs UI.
external.title: Introducing the Improved Search Job Experience in Azure Monitor Log Analytics

record.text: Identities with Custom ID: A Simpler, Smarter Way to Manage Communication Users

external.description:
In today's multi-modal communication landscape, both humans and AI agents can interact across multiple sessions—via chat, voice, or other communication channels. Managing those user sessions securely and consistently has been a challenge when using short-lived, ephemeral identities. Azure Communication Services (ACS) now solves that with Identities with Custom IDs. This new feature allows developers to associate ACS-generated identities with custom application-defined identifiers (like emails or usernames). These custom identifiers make it easy to recognize and reuse an ACS user identity across multiple sessions — enabling smoother experiences, stronger data consistency, and more intelligent engagement across the entire customer journey. 💡 With Custom IDs, developers can now unlock deeper intelligence across customer journeys — from onboarding to support to re-engagement — all powered by consistent identity data. Imagine a telehealth platform where patients log in using their email addresses. Previously, developers had to build and maintain a custom mapping layer to associate those emails with ACS identities. Now, with Custom IDs, that mapping is handled automatically—developers can use the email (or any custom identifier) directly using the customId attribute when creating an Identity, and ACS ensures it consistently maps to the same ACS-generated identity across sessions. How Identity Management is Simplified with Custom IDs: The diagram compares two approaches to identity management in Azure Communication Services: Traditional Identity Flow (Left Diagram): Authentication Initiation – The customer starts the process by logging into the Woodgrove Client App. Token Retrieval – The client app authenticates the user and retrieves a secure token from the Identity and Access Management system (IAM). Identity Mapping – The client app sends an identifier to a back-end identity mapping service, which maps such identifier to an ACS identity. ACS Token Retrieval – The client app obtains an ACS authentication token from the IAM for the mapped ACS identity. Start communication – The client app uses the ACS token to start communication through the different services (chat, calling, etc.) This traditional flow requires the app to manage ACS identity creation and short-lived identifiers for each session. Custom ID Flow with Durable Identity (Right Diagram): Authentication Initiation – The customer starts the process by logging into the Woodgrove Client App. Token Retrieval – The client app authenticates the user and retrieves a secure token from the Identity and Access Management system (IAM). ACS Token creation with custom Id – The client app creates an authentication token using the custom Id and gets an access token for a consistent ACS identity. Start communication – The client app uses the ACS token to start communication through the different services (chat, calling, etc.) This flow eliminates the need to manage ACS identity mapping or short-lived identifiers for each session. Example Code: How Custom ID Works //Authenticate the client var client = new CommunicationIdentityClient(connectionString); // Alphanumeric custom ID string customId = "alice@contoso.com"; // Create Access Tokens with using an Identity with Custom Id var userAndTokenResponse = await client.CreateUserAndTokenAsync(scopes: new[] { CommunicationTokenScope.Chat }, customId: customId); var user = userAndTokenResponse.Value.User; Console.WriteLine($"
User ID: {user.Id}"); // Create another token with the same customId and validate that the same user is returned var userAndTokenResponse2 = await client.CreateUserAndTokenAsync(scopes: new[] { CommunicationTokenScope.Chat }, customId: customId); var user2 = userAndTokenResponse2.Value.User; Console.WriteLine($"
User ID (second call): {user2.Id}"); // Validate they are the same Debug.Assert(user.Id == user2.Id); This confirms that custom IDs map consistently to the same durable ACS identity. 🔄 Repeated calls with alice@contoso.com return the same ACS user ID — demonstrating the reliability of Identities with Custom ID. 🔐 Custom IDs are handled securely and are never exposed beyond your own app’s context, ensuring that identity data remains protected and private. 📌 Explore the sample code and documentation to get started: Identity model, JS SDK, .NET SDK, QuickStart.
external.title: Identities with Custom ID: A Simpler, Smarter Way to Manage Communication Users

Though Post would tragically die just two years later in a crash alongside humorist Will Rogers, his name still soars in the story of flight.

#WileyPost #WinnieMae #SoloFlight #AviationHistory #OnThisDay #RoundTheWorld #Avitation #FlightPioneer

images.alt: Post with Will Rogers hours before their fatal crash on August 15, 1935
The gravestone of Post
Post with Will Rogers hours before their fatal crash on August 15, 1935
The gravestone of Post

record.text: Wiley Post had not only become the first person to fly solo around the globe, he had also shown that the future of aviation would belong to those who dared to trust science and skill.

When he touched down at Floyd Bennett Field, thousands of cheering spectators welcomed him. He had flown around the world in just seven days, eighteen hours, and forty-nine minutes. It was a triumph of human determination and technology.

record.text:
Commanders GM says Trump’s comments don’t make it to him

ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Washington’s NFL franchise used to be in the news all the time for reasons other than football. That seemed to have changed under new team ownership, but President Donald Trump’s remarks about the team name and possibly…

external.description: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Washington’s NFL franchise used to be in the news all the time for reasons other than football. That seemed to have changed under new team ownership, but President Donald Trump’s remarks about the team name and possibly holding up a stadium deal are making waves just as training camp opens. Still, Commanders general manager Adam Peters made clear Tuesday — at a news conference with coach Dan Quinn a day before the team’s first training camp practice — that he doesn’t expect any of that sort of outside conversation to interfere with their real jobs.
external.title: Commanders GM says Trump’s comments don’t make it to him

record.text: Eu tava numa roda de passa bala beijando a moça que seria minha namorada um tempo depois. Me cataram pela blusa e perguntaram se eu sabia a letra de Paradoid " sei uai!” me jogaram no palco e falaram "CANTA AÍ ENTÃO!”

Aí teve um festival de banda num colégio em BSB todo mundo meio torto e eu era o único que não bebia. O vocal da banda que tava apresentando ficou puto com o som  e saiu. A banda tinha que tocar algo mas não sabiam o quê. Aí alguem gritou 
" -QUEM SABE A LETRA DE PARANOID? 
- O Diogo!
- Chama ele!"

Conheci o Black Sabbath jogando vampiro e colocaram o álbum do Paranoid pra ambientar cena. Eu já gostava de rock mas alí a minha cabeça explodiu. Nunca tinha pensado na ideia de música de terror. Era como se Contos da Cripta virasse música e o Ozzy fosse o esqueleto do programa narrando tudo.

external.description:
In 1990 in Florida, a series of horrific killings shook the town as young college students became brutal victims. The perpetrator, Danny Rolling, didn’t just murder his victims—he displayed their bodies in gruesome fashion, carving symbols and arranging them in bizarre poses. Unique elements—like newspaper mantra scraps found at the scenes, an accidental fingerprint left behind, and eyewitness testimony from the night before—are unpacked in chilling detail.

In this episode, you’ll learn how investigators tied together forensic evidence—from DNA traces and fingerprints to emergency call recordings—to unmask the killer and recognize his “ritual” patterns. We also explore eyewitness interview techniques, the psychological profiling process, and vital warning signs that can be overlooked when violence erupts on campus.
external.title: Danny Rolling Florida Student Murders Exposed

external.description: In 1990 in California (though many victims were found along the Pacific Coast Highway, Randy Steven Kraft was also active in Florida), a series of horrifying murders struck young, ambitious college students. The victims—typically male students—were abducted, brutally killed, and then posed in bizarre scenes before their bodies were abandoned. Unique details like Kraft’s “candy wrapper” notes—his coded symbol for each victim—and the discovery of contraceptive devices at crime scenes added layers of mystery to an investigation that spanned decades. In this episode, you’ll learn how law enforcement tied together forensic evidence—from DNA traces to coded entries in the killer’s diary—to reveal both victims’ identities and the perpetrator behind the terror.
external.title: Randy Steven Kraft

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Tragedy of Bianca Devins" on @Spreaker #biancadevins #digitalviolence #internetsafety #killer #onlinepredator #socialmediacrime #truecrime #victim

external.description: Bianca Devins was a 17-year-old teenager who was active on social media and well-known within online communities. But her life came to a tragic end in July 2019 after she was murdered by a man she had met online and had a complicated relationship with. This heartbreaking incident not only shocked her family and friends but also gained national attention when the perpetrator coldly uploaded photos of his crime to social media. The case became a terrifying symbol of the dangers of online relationships and how the digital world can intensify public trauma. In this episode, you’ll learn who Bianca really was, how she met her killer, and what happened the night of the tragedy. We’ll also explore the role social media played in spreading the victim’s photos, how law enforcement responded, and the case's impact on online platform policies. The victim’s identity, the perpetrator, and the disturbing motivations behind this crime will be revealed in detail.
external.title: The Tragedy of Bianca Devins

images.alt:
A review for a Little Caesar’s somewhere by Kevin S: 

Stopped into this Little Caesars just trying to get a $6 pizza and ended up in a full on action movie. Just as I grabbed my order, this furious dude barges in yelling about how I cut him off in traffic earlier.
Before I can even respond, he throws a punch but then out of nowhere the guy behind the counter jumps over it like he's been waiting for this moment his whole life and just beats the living hell out of the guy. The guy ran off and the cashier just dusted himself off. I said "are you ok man" and he looked me dead in the eye and said "B*tch, this is Little Caesars. We always hot and ready."
Five stars. Will absolutely return.

My hairstylist is using it to figure out formulas to color match from photos. It's not supposed to replace you. It's there to take the shit work you waste a bunch of time on and do that faster so you don't have to.

value.text: A new Pew study offers data to back up what we have suspected for a while now: AI answers are draining all the traffic out of the web www.platformer.news/google-ai-ov...

images.alt:
When users did not see an AI overview, the authors write, they clicked on links 15 percent of the time. When they did see one, that number fell nearly by half, to 8 percent.

The study also found that people are likelier to stop browsing after encountering an AI overview, suggesting that the overview has satisfied their curiosity. Researchers saw that outcome 26 percent of the time when AI overviews were displayed, up from 16 percent when they were not.

external.description: 伊隆·马斯克（Elon Musk）于2025年7月5日在社交媒体平台X上宣布成立“美国党”（America Party），旨在挑战美国传统的两党制格局，并声称该党将代表“80%的中间选民”，重点针对2026年国会中期选举，争取在参众两院获得关键席位。根据现有信息，以下是“美国党”的最新进展及现状分析：  最新进展 成立背景与动机：    马斯克成立“美国党”的主要导火索是与美国总统唐纳德·特朗普围绕“大而美”税收和支出法案（Big and Beautiful Bill）的激烈分歧。该法案于2025年7月4日由特朗普签署生效，预计未来十年将增加约3.4万亿美元的联邦赤字，且取消了电动汽车税收抵免，对马斯克旗下特斯拉造成每年约12亿美元的利润损失。    马斯克多次公开批评该法案，称其为“令人作呕的怪物”，并指责其加剧美国债务危机。他在6月5日首次提出组建新政党的想法，并通过X平台发起民调，显示80%以上用户支持成立新党。7月4日，他再次发起投票，65.4%的124.9万名网友支持成立“美国党”。  目标与策略：    马斯克明确表示，“美国党”不以挑战总统选举为目标，而是聚焦于2026年中期选举，争取2-3个参议院席位和8-10个众议院席位。由于两党在国会席位差距较小，“美国党”若能获得少量席位，可能成为争议法案的“决定性投票”，从而影响立法议程。    该党主张财政保守（削减赤字）、支持AI和能源技术、减少政府监管、鼓励生育及维护言论自由，试图吸引对两党极化政治不满的中间派选民。  当前进展：    截至2025年7月，尚无证据显示“美国党”已完成美国选举机构要求的正式注册程序。根据美国法律，新政党需召开党团会议或代表大会，选举临时官员并指定名称，并在50个州收集超过200万选民签名，耗时可能超过18个月。    马斯克于7月6日在X上发帖询问何时何地举行“美国党”首次代表大会，但未见后续具体行动的公开报道。    近期X平台上的帖子表明，马斯克可能已将注意力重新转向公司事务，“美国党”的推进似乎暂无明显进展。  面临的挑战 制度障碍：    美国“赢者通吃”的选举人团制度和严格的选举法规对第三方政党构成结构性障碍。历史上，第三方政党如1992年佩罗的改革党虽获得19%选票，但未能赢得选举人票。    新政党需在各州完成复杂的注册程序，包括收集大量选民签名，这对组织能力和资金要求极高。  政治影响与支持率：    马斯克的支持者主要来自共和党温和派和科技精英，但其模糊的政治定位（既反对高税收又反对赤字增加）可能难以吸引广泛的蓝领或少数族裔选民。    X平台上的一些帖子显示，马斯克的民调支持率在共和党内部大幅下降，从2025年3月的+61%跌至7月的+6%，74%的人反对其领导第三党，显示其政治号召力有限。    专家认为，马斯克缺乏政治经验和成熟的“政治班底”，难以应对复杂的党务运营和选民动员。  市场与投资者反应：    马斯克宣布建党后，特斯拉股价于7月7日下跌近7%，市值蒸发约680亿美元。投资者对其持续涉足政治表示担忧，认为这可能分散其对特斯拉等公司的管理精力。    投资公司Azoria Partners推迟了与特斯拉相关的ETF上市，特斯拉董事会也面临压力，要求马斯克澄清其政治抱负是否影响CEO职责。  未来展望 短期影响：专家认为，“美国党”短期内难以撼动两党制，但可能在2026年中期选举中扮演“搅局者”角色，通过分流共和党选票影响摇摆州的选举结果，间接削弱共和党议程。 长期前景：马斯克的财力（个人净资产约4200亿美元）和X平台（6800万美国用户）的宣传能力为其提供了独特优势，但要建立一个有持久影响力的政党，需克服制度、组织和选民基础的巨大挑战。 不确定性：X平台上的一些评论指出，马斯克的政治举措可能更多是出于与特朗普的个人恩怨，而非深思熟虑的政治战略。其持续性存疑，若缺乏明确政策纲领和持续投入，“美国党”可能胎死腹中。  总结 目前，“美国党”仍处于初步构想阶段，尚未完成正式注册，也未见具体的组织活动或候选人推选。马斯克的建党计划引发了广泛关注，但受限于美国选举制度、其自身政治经验不足以及投资者和公众的质疑，其前景不明朗。近期他似乎将重心转回企业事务，“美国党”的后续发展可能暂时搁置。建议关注X平台及主流媒体的进一步报道，以获取最新动态。  如果你想了解更多细节或需要我分析某一方面（如政策主张或选民基础），请告诉我！

images.alt:
A review for a Little Caesar’s somewhere by Kevin S: 

Stopped into this Little Caesars just trying to get a $6 pizza and ended up in a full on action movie. Just as I grabbed my order, this furious dude barges in yelling about how I cut him off in traffic earlier.
Before I can even respond, he throws a punch but then out of nowhere the guy behind the counter jumps over it like he's been waiting for this moment his whole life and just beats the living hell out of the guy. The guy ran off and the cashier just dusted himself off. I said "are you ok man" and he looked me dead in the eye and said "B*tch, this is Little Caesars. We always hot and ready."
Five stars. Will absolutely return.

Original tweet: Just spotted some POO's on the street. (Did ANYONE workshop this?)

Reply from TTC Media Relations: Yes, Matt. We were kids once too and the acronym was thought through, but the designation was not ours to begin with..
It existed in Ontario legislation long before the TTC began using it this weekend.
A simple search through this document shows multiple references.
 
https://ontario.ca/laws/statute/90p33
 
We thank the snickering, puerile 12-year-old boys who dominate the internet for their insights.
However, it does not negate the fact that fare cheats face fines of hundreds of dollars – which is no laughing matter.
